metadata.Title: CVE-2022-20009 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: In various functions of the USB gadget subsystem, there is a possible out of bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID: A-213172319References: Upstream kernel

notes.Note: alexmurray> Apparently this is a duplicate of CVE-2022-25258 and CVE-2022-25375

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
